alert.note: Alert for Lee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lee County through 645 PM CDT... At 629 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Ashton, or 9 miles northeast of Amboy, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Lee County. Including the following interstate... I-88 between mile markers 65 and 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
